updated_cases.title: Verify proxy handles incoming TLS 1/0/1.1 connections appropriately
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify proxy handles incoming TLS 1/0/1.1 connections appropriately
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1) Configure Firefox to use either TLS1.0 ot 1.1
2) Access any app or website depending on the steering config.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
Similar error message should be seen on proxy:
2020-02-10 22:28:35        ERROR        localhost        14543               SSL 14569:          cpp/SslLayer.cpp:00823 trid=1714307427224879104 rqid=1714307427224879105 tenantid=1 user='127.0.0.1' mode='SERVER', lname='explicit-proxy', rip='127.0.0.1', rp='40606', oip='127.0.0.1', op='40606', lip='127.0.0.1', lp='8000', sni='127.0.0.1', fd='138', 
SSL handshake error '-1' sslerr='1' sslerrdesc='error:14209102:SSL routines:tls_early_post_process_client_hello:unsupported protocol' sslerrfunc='521' sslerrreason='258'

updated_cases.title: Verify proxy handles outgoing TLS 1/0/1.1 connections appropriately
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify proxy handles outgoing TLS 1/0/1.1 connections appropriately
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1) Configure webserver to use TLSv 1.0/1.1
2) Create an entry in /etc/hosts mapping IP of the server to www.myapptest.com 
3) Use the following curl command to access the web server:
 curl -k https://myapptest.com -H 'Host: 34.217.209.18'
 

OR

Enable feature "fwd-server-ssl-error" using provisioner api. This will return the error as the output of the above curl command.

updated_cases.title: Verify proxy handles the connection appropriately when both incoming and outgoing connections use TLS 1/0/1.2
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify proxy handles the connection appropriately when both incoming and outgoing connections use TLS 1/0/1.1
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1) Configure Firefox to use either TLS1.0 ot 1.1
2) Configure webserver to use TLSv 1.0/1.1
2) Create an entry in /etc/hosts mapping IP of the server to www.myapptest.com 
3) Use the following curl command to access the web server:
 curl -k https://myapptest.com -H 'Host: 34.217.209.18'
updated_cases.custom_expected:
Similar error message should be seen on proxy:
2020-02-10 22:28:35        ERROR        localhost        14543               SSL 14569:          cpp/SslLayer.cpp:00823 trid=1714307427224879104 rqid=1714307427224879105 tenantid=1 user='127.0.0.1' mode='SERVER', lname='explicit-proxy', rip='127.0.0.1', rp='40606', oip='127.0.0.1', op='40606', lip='127.0.0.1', lp='8000', sni='127.0.0.1', fd='138', 
SSL handshake error '-1' sslerr='1' sslerrdesc='error:14209102:SSL routines:tls_early_post_process_client_hello:unsupported protocol' sslerrfunc='521' sslerrreason='258'

updated_cases.title: Enable feature using provisioner API call
updated_cases.custom_steps: Run the provisioner API call to enable feature
updated_cases.custom_expected: Success response should be seen as a result

updated_cases.title: Disable feature using provisioner API call
updated_cases.custom_steps: Run the provisioner API call to disable feature
updated_cases.custom_expected: Success response should be seen as a result

updated_cases.title: Verify the http header profile creation on dpmgmtsvc
updated_cases.custom_steps:
Create http header profile with pre-defined and customer header
Login to dpmgmtsvc and verify the opt/ns/configshare/dp/opt/ns/tenant//http_header_profile.json
updated_cases.custom_expected: http_header_profile.json should have the profiles created in UI

updated_cases.title: Verify the http header profile preprocessing on dpmgmtsvc
updated_cases.custom_steps:
Create http header profile with pre-defined and customer header
Login to dpmgmtsvc and verify the preprocessed data in opt/ns/configshare/dp/opt/ns/tenant//http_header_profile_v2.json

updated_cases.title: Verify proxy log for matching custom http headers
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Create a policy with htttp header profile custom header
2. Send traffic matching the policy
3. monitor mtnsproxy.log for http header value match
updated_cases.custom_expected: mtnsproxy.log should have the match http header value for custom header

updated_cases.title: Verify proxy log for non-matching custom http headers
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Create a policy with htttp header profile custom header
2. Send traffic not matching the policy
3. Monitor mtnsproxy.log for no http header value match
updated_cases.custom_expected: mtnsproxy.log should not have the match http header value for custom header

updated_cases.title: Verify traffic sent to OCSP stapling server which sends complete server certificate with OCSP/CRL set to block
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Bringup/Find OCSP stapling server which sends certificate chain
ex: rltrac.com
- Send traffit to above server
- Proxy establishes connection
